questions.question: A car starts from rest and accelerates uniformly at 2 m/s² for 10 s. Find the final velocity and the distance covered.
A train moving at 20 m/s slows down uniformly to stop in 50 s. Find its acceleration and the distance traveled before stopping.
A motorbike accelerates uniformly from 5 m/s to 25 m/s over a distance of 200 m. Find its acceleration and the time taken.
A bus travels along a straight road with a uniform acceleration of 1.5 m/s². If its initial velocity is 12 m/s, find its velocity after 8 s and the distance covered in that time.
A car moving at 30 m/s applies brakes and comes to rest in 60 m. Find the magnitude of its deceleration and the time taken to stop.
A vehicle accelerates uniformly from 10 m/s to 30 m/s in 5 s. Find the distance traveled during this interval.
A cyclist moving at 8 m/s accelerates uniformly at 0.5 m/s² for 20 s. Calculate the final velocity and the total distance traveled.
A train moving at 18 m/s starts decelerating uniformly at 0.6 m/s². How far will it travel before coming to rest?
A car moving at 15 m/s accelerates at 2 m/s² for 4 s, then continues at constant speed. Find the distance covered during the acceleration phase.
A vehicle starts from rest and accelerates at 3 m/s² for 12 s. Find its final velocity and the distance traveled in that time.
